metadata.context: Fleetio is a fleet management SaaS product. These rules determine whether a claimed exemption type makes sense for a SaaS purchase.

GOVERNMENT.note: Many fleet customers are government entities. Standard Fleetio customer profile.

NONPROFIT.note: Nonprofits often have fleets (Goodwill, Salvation Army, transit nonprofits, etc.).

RESALE.note: Depends on whether the purchaser genuinely resells SaaS vs. consumes it internally. See resale_tiers below.

MANUFACTURING.reason: Manufacturing exemptions cover property used directly in production. Fleet management SaaS is business support, not production input.
MANUFACTURING.review_note: Entity may qualify under a different exemption basis (e.g., if the entity is a government or nonprofit, suggest correct form).

AGRICULTURE.reason: No state extends agricultural exemptions to software. Ag exemptions cover TPP and enumerated equipment/supplies only.
AGRICULTURE.review_note: Entity may qualify under alternative exemption basis. Farms with fleet vehicles may be legitimate Fleetio customers — the issue is the exemption category, not the entity.

COMMON_CARRIER.reason: OH common carrier exemption (ORC § 5739.02(B)(32)) covers items 'physically part of the vehicle.' Explicitly excludes 'office equipment, computers, building supplies or anything else that is not part of the motor vehicles.' Cloud-accessed SaaS does not qualify.
COMMON_CARRIER.note: This exemption type is essentially never valid for SaaS. Flag as likely invalid but route to human review rather than auto-reject.

INDUSTRIAL_RD.reason: Industrial/R&D exemption is a significant stretch for fleet management SaaS. Possible only if customer is using fleet data for R&D purposes.
INDUSTRIAL_RD.review_note: Low probability of validity but not auto-reject.

DIRECT_PAY.note: Direct Pay permits shift tax collection responsibility to purchaser. Seller is fully protected. Validate permit number format.
DIRECT_PAY.validation: OH: 8-digit starting with 98. Check against OH active permits list in Phase 2.

CONSTRUCTION.note: Some states have specific contractor exemption rules. Fleet SaaS for a construction fleet is plausible — the contractor exemption category is the concern, not the use case.
CONSTRUCTION.review_note: Accept but note that contractor exemptions vary significantly by state.

DIPLOMATIC.note: Diplomatic/foreign mission exemptions are valid but rare for Fleetio's customer base.

OTHER.note: Unrecognized exemption category — requires human classification.

resale_tiers._comment: When a customer claims resale exemption on SaaS, classify their business into these tiers based on business description.

TIER_1_STRONG.label: Strong resale claim
TIER_1_STRONG.description: Explicitly resells software or technology services

TIER_2_PLAUSIBLE.label: Plausible resale claim
TIER_2_PLAUSIBLE.description: Captive finance/leasing company that may bundle SaaS with vehicle leases
TIER_2_PLAUSIBLE.note: TX resale nuance: 01-339 covers items 'resold, rented or leased.' If SaaS subscription transfers to lessee, resale may apply.

TIER_3_WEAK.label: Weak resale claim — needs review
TIER_3_WEAK.description: End-user service business claiming resale with no obvious resale channel for SaaS
TIER_3_WEAK.review_note: These businesses typically consume fleet SaaS internally. Resale claim is suspicious but not impossible.

TIER_4_IMPLAUSIBLE.label: Implausible resale claim — likely invalid
TIER_4_IMPLAUSIBLE.description: Business clearly consuming the product internally with no conceivable resale mechanism
TIER_4_IMPLAUSIBLE.review_note: Route to human review but recommend rejection. WA penalty: 50% of tax due + interest + permit revocation (WAC 458-20-102).

wrong_box_rules._comment: How to handle when a legitimately exempt entity checks the wrong exemption category box.

sst_states.reason: SST Four Corners doctrine: if cert is fully completed and exemption was statutorily available, seller is protected regardless of category checked.

good_faith_states.reason: Good faith states (TX, NY, PA, CA, etc.) may scrutinize category mismatch. PA requirement #4: 'property/service consistent with exemption to which customer is entitled.'
good_faith_states.exception: Government entities checking wrong category box → NOTE only (entity is genuinely exempt regardless)

wrong_box_rules.case_law_note: As of February 2026, no case law exists where a seller lost protection solely because a legitimately exempt buyer checked the wrong exemption category box. PA, TX, and NY auditors resolve with corrected cert, not retroactive tax.

seller_name_variants._comment: Acceptable variants of Fleetio's name on certificates.
